Routine	smears	are	only	offered	
to women over 25. If you are 
due to have a cervical smear 
(if you have not had one in 
the last three years), you will 
probably be told to wait until 
three months after your baby is 
born unless you have a history 
of abnormal smears. This is 
based on guidance by the HSC 
cervical screening programme. 
For more information, go to 
www.cancerscreening.hscni.net
Herpes
